citation.article-title: Thermoproteus uzoniensis sp. nov., a new extremely thermophilic archaebacterium from Kamachatka continental hot springs

p.s: Description of Thermoproteus uzoniensis sp. nov.
Thermoproteus uzoniensis (u.zo.ni'en.sis L. masc. adj. uzoniensis - inhabiting hot springs and soil of the Uzon caldera)
Cells 0.3-0.4 by 3-20 μm rods, some of them branching or forming spherical protrusions on the ends, or at the branching points.
The cell envelope consists of hexagonally packed subunits covered on the outer side by a layer with less clearly defined structure.
Cells are non-motile and have no flagella.
Utilizes peptides, simultaneously reducing elemental sulfur, but does not depend on it obligatory.
Production of fermentation products such as acetate, isobutyrate, isovalerate.
G+ C content of Z-605 isolate is 56.5 mol%.
The habitat is hot springs, soil and geothermal waters of the Uzon caldera (Kamchatka).
Type strain is Thermoproteus uzoniensis Z-605, DSM 5263, Braunschweig-Stöckheim, FRG.
